intro: Neogaillonia pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful neogall, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its attractive, palmate leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Neogaillonia pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
